items.title: HUL shares in focus after firm sets December 5 as record date for ice-cream business demerger
items.description: HUL shares: The company's board has fixed record date for the demerger of it's ice-cream division.

items.title: KEC International shares in spotlight as Power Grid Corp bars firm from new tenders for 9 months
items.description: KEC International shares: The company sid that Power Grid has banned it for bidding for the utility tenders.

items.title: Devyani International among 5 stocks that closed above VWAP, signaling a bullish shift
items.description: On November 18, the closing prices of five stocks in the Nifty500 pack rallied more than 1% above their VWAP (Volume-Weighted Average Price). A move above the VWAP indicates a potential bullish trend, according to technical scan data from stockedge.com.When the closing price rises above the VWAP, it signifies that the stock closed higher than the average price at which it traded throughout the day, with the average weighted by trading volume. This is often interpreted by traders and investors as a bullish signal, indicating strengthening market sentiment.

items.title: Bombay Burmah among 7 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.description: On November 18, seven stocks from the Nifty500 pack were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from stockedge.com. An uptrend signal occurs when the RSI value crosses above 50 from below. “RSI Trending Up” indicates that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting strengthening momentum in the stock price. This can signal potential upward movement and may help traders identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Inside the short-selling trap of Groww's near multibagger surge: What happened and what it means for investors?
items.description: Groww shares faced unusual settlement problems after a strong rally. Over 30 lakh shares went into auction due to short sellers unable to deliver. A short squeeze intensified the price rise. While the auction settled deliveries, investors now watch for fundamental trading as extreme pressures ease. Valuations are a key concern for the future.

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: Sun Tv, Glenmark Pharma among 5 stocks that could give 17-33% return
items.description: Analysts remain broadly bullish across sectors, with multiple brokerages issuing fresh Buy calls and highlighting meaningful upside potential.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: Negative Breakout: These 12 stocks cross below their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty500 pack, 12 stocks' close prices crossed below their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on November 18, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. Trading below the 200 DMA is considered a negative signal because it indicates that the stock's price is below its long-term trend line. The 200 DMA is used as a key indicator by traders for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. Take a look:

items.title: S&P 500 ends down for a 4th day as valuation worries weigh, Home Depot drops
items.description: Indian markets mirrored global sentiment as US stocks tumbled, driven by tech stock valuations and a weak Home Depot forecast. Investors eagerly await Nvidia's results amid AI exuberance concerns. Job market data also showed a cooling trend, adding to market jitters. Despite strong overall earnings, fears are circulating.

items.title: US market slide frays investors' nerves with AI trade, rate-cut doubts
items.description: U.S. stocks are experiencing their biggest pullback in months, raising investor nerves ahead of key tests for the AI trade and interest rate cut expectations. Nvidia's earnings report and upcoming employment data will be crucial in determining the market's direction as investors assess economic health and potential Fed policy shifts.

items.title: GIFT Nifty up 35 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Equity markets declined on Tuesday as investors booked profits amid diminished expectations of a US Fed rate cut. Analysts suggest progress on the Indo-US trade deal and a strong domestic earnings outlook could revive confidence and support the Nifty's ascent towards 26,000. The India VIX rose, indicating increased market fear.

items.title: Stocks in news: Groww, HUL, Infosys, Sequent Scientific, TCS, Azad Engineering
items.description: Indian markets experienced a volatile trading session on weekly expiry day, declining by nearly half a percent. This extends the current consolidation phase. Analysts suggest a cautiously optimistic undertone supported by firm domestic macro indicators. Several companies like Groww, HUL, Adani Ports, TCS, and Infosys are in focus due to recent developments and upcoming corporate actions.

items.title: Asian shares fluctuate after three-day selloff
items.description: Asian equities showed mixed performance as global markets reacted to Wall Street's sharp losses, particularly in tech stocks driven by AI concerns. Investors are closely watching Nvidia's earnings report and the Federal Reserve's potential interest rate decisions amid renewed market volatility and mixed economic data.

items.title: FPIs favour Indian debt inclusion in Bloomberg's Global Aggregate Index
items.description: Foreign portfolio investors have offered positive feedback on Bloomberg Aggregate Index services, boosting the likelihood of Indian debt being included in the global index. Participants cited ease of trading, India's sovereign rating, and competitive bond returns as key factors. This follows India's inclusion in the emerging market local currency bond index earlier this year.

items.title: ED widens probe into 50+ entities over penny stock laundering
items.description: The Enforcement Directorate is investigating over 50 individuals and firms for alleged money laundering through penny stock price rigging. Notices have been issued under the PMLA, requiring disclosure of financial information and associations with manipulated companies. This probe follows a raid on a tech firm, uncovering a syndicate involved in elaborate stock manipulation schemes.

items.title: Why has CreditAccess Grameen fallen nearly 10% since its Q2 results?
items.description: CreditAccess Grameen's stock has declined due to concerns over higher credit costs stemming from delayed improvement in its portfolio at risk. Despite accelerated write-offs in H1 FY26, the company is focusing on customer accretion and enhancing borrower quality. Analysts anticipate improved return ratios in the latter half of the fiscal year.

items.title: Operating in niche areas & having gone through many business cycles: 5 small-cap stocks that fit the bill for long-term investors
items.description: A few more weeks of the Nifty and Sensex moving upward, and investors will again start to look at small-cap stocks with interest. Nothing wrong with that. But when it comes to small-caps, just check if the company has some advantage. It could be a product, a brand, a niche segment, or that it meets certain financial criteria. If it has some of these, then buy it and ride the rally over the long term to create wealth. The key words here are long term.
